intro: Tinus sprengelii, commonly known as the Sprengel's tinus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features small, pea-like flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. It is a herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets.
